questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

A customer wants to configure their team of 10 agents to answer incoming calls to a common central number. The phone for each team member must ring in sequence and ring four times before moving to the next member's phone. Drag and drop the steps from the left into the order on the right to make this happen.

//IMG//

An organization needs to ensure that the Cisco UCM can provide a resume softkey to users on their desk phones when they disconnect an anchored call on their mobile phone. Which solution must be used to accomplish these goals?

choices.A: Set the "Retain Media on Disconnect with PI for Active Call" service parameter to False.
choices.B: Set the "Retain Media on Disconnect with PI for Active Call" service parameter to True.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
As per CUCM 15 help:
Retain Media on Disconnect with PI for Active Call: This parameter specifies the behavior of Cisco CallManager on receiving a PRI DISCONNECT or H225 ReleaseComplete message with progress indicator of 8 (inband information available) for the active call only. Valid values specify True (Cisco CallManager will hold on the media connection, so the other side will receive an announcement or inband tone) or False (Cisco CallManager will tear down the call immediately). Keep this parameter set to the default value (False) unless a Cisco support engineer instructs otherwise.

imo B is a correct answer

Selected Answer: B
Why B is Correct:
"Retain Media on Disconnect with PI for Active Call" Service Parameter:

When set to True, CUCM retains the media session for anchored calls even if the mobile phone disconnects. This allows users to resume the call on their desk phones using the Resume softkey.
Resume Softkey for Anchored Calls:

The Resume softkey appears on the user's desk phone, enabling them to continue the call from where it left off after disconnecting the mobile device.

Selected Answer: B
This is the correct answer.

Selected Answer: A
Recommended Action
Perform the following actions:

Add the following command to the gateway:

voice call disc-pi-off

For the Cisco CallManager service, set the Retain Media on Disconnect with PI for Active Call service parameter to False.

questions.question_text: An engineer needs to deploy the local route group feature to a Cisco UCM server by using the standard local route group. For each device pool, the engineer needs to specify a different PSTN access for emergency calls. What must the engineer do?

choices.A: Add a new standard local route group. Select a route group as the new standard local route group in Device Pools. Create a route pattern of 911 that points to a route list that contains the new standard local route group.
choices.D: Add a new standard local route group. Select a route group as the new standard local route group in Device Pools. Create a route pattern of 911 that points to the new standard local route group.
choices.C: Set a new local route group name. Select a route group as the new local route group in Device Pools. Create a route pattern of 911 that points to the new local route group.
choices.B: Create a new local route group name. In Device Pools, select a route group for that new local route group. Create a route pattern of 911 that points to a route list that contains the new local route group.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
youtube.com/watch?v=9j2xNvSN5fw explains the topic. 
B is a correct answer

Selected Answer: B
The feature is call local route group, and standard local route group is one of the names

questions.question_text: A company wants to use a Cisco phone system without the need for a local generic server. It is maximum 30 phones using a vendor-independent, industry-standard call protocol. What is the first command that must be entered to add this type of phone when registering a Cisco phone to this device?

discussion.content:
I stand corrected, A is correct

CUBE requires transcoding resources registered locally in these scenarios
...
Interworking between an OOB method and RFC2833 for flow-around calls

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/unified-communications/unified-border-element/200412-DTMF-Relay-and-Interworking-on-CUBE.html

CUBE requires transcoding resources registered locally in these scenarios

Interworking between RFC2833 and Voice In-band
Interworking between an OOB method and RFC2833 for flow-around calls
CUBE is able to interwork between all other DTMF relay methods with flow-through calls without the need for a transcoder.

A is correct

Selected Answer: A
When Does CUBE Require Transcoding Resources for DTMF
CUBE requires transcoding resources registered locally in these scenarios

Interworking between RFC2833 and Voice In-band
Interworking between an OOB method and RFC2833 for flow-around calls
CUBE is able to interwork between all other DTMF relay methods with flow-through calls without the need of a transcoder.

Supported In-band DTMF Relay Methods
In-band audio DTMF through G711
RFC2833
Supported Out-Of-Band DMTF Relay Methods
H.245 Alphanumeric
H.245 Signal
SIP Unsolicited NOTIFY
SIP KPML
SIP INFO

Correct answer C , ( media flow-around call , flow-through calls)

Correct answer is A. 
@zeroblasted : We're not talking about transcoding codecs but DTMF relay. 

Interworking between an OOB method and RFC2833 for flow-around calls
CUBE is able to interwork between all other DTMF relay methods with flow-through calls without the need of a transcoder.
media flow-around indicates the media does NOT flow through the CUBE but rather directly between UAC and UAS. Hence, you cannot transcode resources that don't touch the CUBE. Correct answer is C

questions.question_text: For s SIP to SIP call flow, when does Cisco Unified Border Element require transcoding resources for DTMF?

choices.A: interworking between an OOB method and RFC2833 for flow-around calls
choices.C: interworking between an OOB method and RFC2833 for flow-through calls
choices.D: interworking between h245-alpha numeric and sip-kpml
